title: 'I want India's GenZ to understand ... ': Rahul accuses EC, BJP of vote theft in Haryana
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP of "stealing" the Haryana Assembly election mandate, alleging a deliberate plan to convert Congress victories into BJP wins. He cited numerous complaints from candidates about vote count irregularities and announced the compilation of "H Files" detailing the alleged manipulation, criticizing the Election Commission for subverting the democratic process.

title: 'Who is this woman?' Rahul says Brazilian model voted 22 times in Haryana
content: Rahul Gandhi ignited a political storm, alleging widespread voter fraud in Haryana. He presented evidence suggesting approximately 25 lakh voters are fake, duplicate, or manipulated.  Gandhi highlighted a striking example: a single photograph appearing multiple times with different names and details, claiming it belonged to a 'Brazilian model' used as a stock image for fraudulent entries. This accusation comes just before the Bihar polls.

title: Watch: Zohran Mamdani ends speech with Dhoom Machale track
content: New York City has elected Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old leftist and the city's first Muslim mayor. His victory speech, referencing Jawaharlal Nehru and concluding with the Bollywood hit "Dhoom Machale," resonated with supporters and sparked widespread online amusement. Mamdani, who faced significant opposition, vowed to make the city a beacon of hope and a place for working people.

title: Delhi pollution: AQI remains in 'poor' category
content: Delhi's air quality saw a slight improvement on Wednesday, with the AQI at 228, still in the 'poor' category. Authorities have issued over 20,000 challans under GRAP-2 since October 19, 2025, targeting polluting vehicles. Commercial vehicles not registered in Delhi and below BS-3 standards are being turned back. Water sprinkling operations are underway to combat pollution.

title: 'There is a bigger picture': Morne Morkel reveals why India rested Arshdeep Singh
content: Bowling coach Morne Morkel explained Arshdeep Singh's rest in the T20I series against Australia was for experimenting with bowling combinations ahead of the T20 World Cup. Arshdeep returned strongly, earning Player of the Match. Meanwhile, Nitish Kumar Reddy was ruled out due to ongoing fitness concerns.

title: Clearing the confusion: ChatGPT not banned from health/legal info; OpenAI health chief explains viral 'ban' claim
content: OpenAI has firmly denied viral social media claims that ChatGPT's usage policy now bans legal or medical advice. The company clarified that core functionality and guidelines remain unchanged, with no new restrictions imposed.

title: 'A moment comes in history ... ': Zohran Mamdani invokes Nehru in victory speech — Watch
content: New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, invoked India's first Prime Minister Nehru in his victory speech, declaring a "mandate for change." The 34-year-old, the city's youngest and first Muslim mayor, vowed to show the nation how to defeat Donald Trump. Mamdani's win, against formidable opponents, marks a significant shift in the city's political landscape.

title: Travelling alone on shoestring budget: Making of India's 90th GM Ilamparthy - at just 16 years old
content: Thirteen-year-old Ilamparthi, initially an uninvited guest at a chess camp, has now become India's 90th Grandmaster. Guided by GM Shyam Sundar Mohanraj, his journey, despite financial hardships and family challenges, is marked by exceptional talent and unwavering discipline. The young prodigy's dedication promises a bright future in the chess world.

title: US China AI race: Trump praises Nvidia's flagship chip; why Jensen Huang not 'happy'
content: President Trump has declared that China will not acquire Nvidia's advanced Blackwell chips, asserting the technology is exclusively for the United States. This move aims to maintain American dominance in the AI race, despite Nvidia's CEO hoping for future sales. US lawmakers also voiced concerns about supplying such critical technology to a primary adversary.

title: 'Countdown to November Revolution': Karnataka BJP trolls Congress over CM post
content: The BJP is mocking the Congress party over the Karnataka chief minister's post.  Speculation about a leadership change is ongoing.  The BJP released a spoof video on X.  It shows a game of musical chairs with Congress leaders.  The video is titled 'November Revolution'.  The BJP calls it a power struggle disguised as governance.

title: 'So hear me, president ...': Mamdani's 'four words' message to Trump
content: New York has elected its first Muslim mayor, Zohran Mamdani, who immediately challenged Donald Trump, vowing to fight hate and inequality. Mamdani pledged reforms against 'bad landlords,' a citywide rent freeze, and expanded labor protections, emphasizing economic justice. He also celebrated New York as a city of immigrants, directly confronting Trump's policies and asserting the city's inclusive identity.

title: 'Forever etched in my skin': Harmanpreet gets inked after India win - unveils tattoo
content: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur celebrated the historic ICC Women's World Cup 2025 triumph with a special tattoo. The ink features the trophy, the year 2025, and the 52-run victory margin against South Africa. Kaur, who fulfilled a childhood dream, shared her emotional journey and encouraged aspiring cricketers to never stop dreaming.

title: After $12.6 billion Amazon stake cut, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes one of her biggest donations
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University a remarkable $80 million, one of its largest donations ever, bolstering diversity and equity initiatives. This substantial, unrestricted contribution will aid student aid, infrastructure, and operations, arriving at a crucial time for the institution. Scott's ongoing philanthropic spree includes significant gifts to other DEI causes and a reduction in her Amazon holdings.

title: Bihar: JD(U) leader Neeranjan Kushwaha’s brother, wife, daughter found dead
content: The elder brother of a JD(U) leader, his wife, and daughter were discovered deceased in their Purnea residence. Police recovered the bodies on Tuesday night and have sent them for post-mortem examinations. An investigation is underway to determine the cause of death, with forensic experts collecting evidence from the scene.

title: UP: 6 devotees killed as train runs over crowd at Chunar railway station
content: Six devotees died and several were injured after being hit by a train while en route to Ganga Snan on Kartik Purnima in Uttar Pradesh. Local authorities and rescue teams responded swiftly, with the injured being transported to hospitals for treatment. An investigation into the tragic incident has been initiated by the police.

title: Tipping point! Malleswari to Sindhu, Mary Kom to Nikhat — WC win is every girl athlete's dream
content: India's women's cricket World Cup victory marks a monumental leap for women's sports, echoing a century of pioneering athletes. This triumph transcends cricket, inspiring countless girls to pursue their dreams and challenging societal norms.  It signifies a new era of recognition, dignity, and rewarding careers for female athletes across the nation.

title: ‘People were yelping for help’: Survivor recounts Chhattisgarh train collision
content: A passenger train collided with a stationary goods train near Bilaspur, Chhattisgarh, killing at least 11 people and injuring several others. The severe impact caused one passenger coach to climb onto a goods train wagon. Relief and rescue operations are underway, with ex-gratia compensation announced for victims and their families.

title: A mayor of many firsts: What makes Zohran Mamdani's victory historical
content: Zohran Mamdani made history as the first Muslim, Indian-origin, South Asian, and youngest mayor of New York City. A self-declared democratic socialist, his victory signifies a generational and ideological shift in the city. Mamdani's platform focused on lowering costs and making New York more affordable through rent freezes, fare-free buses, and free childcare.

title: New dawn for women’s cricket! From pay parity to World Cup glory — India have arrived
content: India’s historic World Cup triumph marks a watershed moment for women’s cricket — a potential 1983-like turning point. With BCCI’s push for pay parity, the WPL’s success, and rising visibility, Harmanpreet Kaur’s team has laid the foundation for lasting change. The victory promises not just glory, but a redefined, self-sustaining future for women’s cricket in India.

title: Hack of the day: Check if email, password was in data leak
content: The Times of India's 'Hack of the Day' series offers practical solutions for everyday problems. This installment focuses on checking if your email has been compromised in data breaches. Using the free and secure website Have I Been Pwned, you can quickly verify your email's exposure without sharing your password.

title: ‘Too much’ exposure to US? Reliance cuts Russian crude buys; to stop imports from sanctioned firms
content: Reliance Industries has significantly reduced its crude oil imports from Russia, anticipating a complete halt from sanctioned entities by November 21. This strategic shift aims to comply with Western sanctions and maintain access to US and European markets. The company is increasing imports from the Middle East and the US to compensate for the reduced Russian supply.

title: Salman Khan faces legal trouble for paan masala endorsement; served notice by Kota consumer court
content: Bollywood superstar Salman Khan has received a legal notice from a consumer court in Kota over endorsing an elaichi product. The complaint also raises concerns about encouraging youth to consume harmful paan masala.

title: Watch: Mumbai monorail tilts at Wadala–GTB Nagar station
content: A monorail experienced a tilt during routine testing at Wadala–GTB Nagar station on Wednesday morning due to a suspected technical fault. No passengers were on board, and no injuries were reported. Monorail officials and the Mumbai Fire Brigade responded quickly to the incident near the RTO junction.

title: Meet Mira Nair, mother of Zohran Mamdani — New York City’s first Muslim mayor
content: New York City ushers in a new era with Zohran Mamdani, its first Muslim and South Asian mayor. His political journey is deeply influenced by his mother, acclaimed filmmaker Mira Nair, whose work champions marginalized voices and bridges cultural divides. Mamdani's campaign for affordability and justice reflects values instilled through his upbringing, mirroring his mother's storytelling.

title: How Zohran Mamdani’s wife Rama Duwaji quietly helped his campaign behind the scenes
content: Rama Duwaji, wife of mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, has been a quiet but impactful force behind his campaign. The Syrian-American artist shaped the campaign's visual identity and digital strategy, offering crucial creative support while remaining largely out of the public eye. Her influence has been instrumental in crafting Mamdani's modern, grassroots appeal.

title: Borrowed Rs 500, won Rs 11 crore: Vegetable seller hits Punjab jackpot
content: A humble vegetable vendor from Jaipur, Amit Sehra, has won the Rs 11 crore Punjab State Lottery Diwali Bumper 2025. He purchased the winning ticket after borrowing Rs 500 from a friend, as he had no money. Sehra plans to gift Rs 1 lakh to his friend before making any decisions for his own family.

title: Here are the billionaires who fueled anti-Zohran Mamdani campaign but failed
content: Zohran Mamdani, a progressive Indian-origin Democrat, has been elected New York City's new mayor, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa.  His victory, powered by young voters and immigrants, makes him the city's first Muslim mayor and highest-ranking Muslim official in the US.  Despite significant spending by billionaires opposing his tax-the-rich platform, Mamdani secured a historic win with record turnout.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi batters Philippines: 90 dead, dozens missing; floods ravage Cebu
content: Typhoon Kalmaegi has devastated the Philippines, claiming at least 90 lives and leaving dozens missing, primarily in Cebu province where flash floods caused widespread destruction.  Six Air Force personnel perished in a helicopter crash during a relief mission.  Authorities are investigating potential causes for the severe flooding, as the nation grapples with its vulnerability to natural disasters.

title: Op Chhatru: Security forces launch anti-terror operation in J&K's Kishtwar
content: Security forces have initiated an anti-terror operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar following specific intelligence. Alert troops of the Army's White Knight Corps engaged terrorists in the Chhatru area, leading to an exchange of fire. The operation is currently ongoing.

title: Trump reacts to Zohran Mamdani winning NYC mayor race; defends Republican loss
content: Donald Trump attributed Republican losses in the New York City mayoral race to his absence from the ballot and government shutdowns. Zohran Mamdani, a Democratic socialist, became the city's youngest and first Muslim mayor, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa amidst record voter turnout. Trump had previously warned against Mamdani's victory, calling him a "Communist lunatic."

title: Gold rate prediction: Will gold continue to face upside resistance in near term?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are facing pressure due to a strengthening dollar and a constructive US-China outcome, with Spot Gold slumping below $4000 per Oz. Investors are also reacting to China's reduced VAT exemption on gold.  Despite short-term headwinds, Indian wedding season demand and year-end uncertainties could support gold prices in the longer term.

title: Charlise Springer breaks silence after Blue Jays' World Series heartbreak
content: The Toronto Blue Jays' World Series dream ended in heartbreak, but George Springer's wife, Charlise, offered a message of gratitude and pride. Her words highlighted the team's resilience and the lasting memories created, reminding fans that baseball's true value lies in connection and shared moments, not just wins. The team vows to 'run it back' next season.

title: Dodgers star Alex Vesia misses parade due to family matter
content: While the Los Angeles Dodgers celebrated their World Series victory, relief pitcher Alex Vesia was notably absent due to a personal family matter. He and his wife are facing an undisclosed situation, having stepped away from baseball before the championship. Teammates and even rivals showed support, with the Dodgers dedicating their win to him.

title: How to submit your Life Certificate 2025 online and offline
content: Pensioners across India must submit a Life Certificate annually to continue receiving their benefits. The government has digitized this process through Jeevan Pramaan, an Aadhaar-based biometric system. This eliminates the need for physical visits, offering a convenient and secure way for elderly citizens to verify their existence and ensure uninterrupted pension payments.

title: Kabaddi player Gurvinder Singh shot dead in Punjab; Bishnoi gang claims responsibility
content: Kabaddi player Gurvinder Singh was allegedly shot and killed in Ludhiana, Punjab, with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang claiming responsibility. This follows another fatal attack on a Kabaddi player, Tejpal, on October 31, 2025, raising concerns about escalating gang violence. Police are investigating the social media claims and heightened security is in place.

title: NYC mayoral election: Trump's foe Mamdani wins high-stake battle
content: Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old state assembly member, has been elected New York City's youngest and first Muslim mayor, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. The election saw record turnout, with Mamdani, once a protest candidate, triumphing in a contest heavily influenced by Donald Trump's vocal opposition and threats to cut federal funding.

title: Stock market holiday: Will NSE & BSE remain open or closed for Guru Nanak Jayanti?
content: Indian stock markets, including the NSE and BSE, will be closed on Wednesday, November 5, in observance of Guru Nanak Jayanti. Trading will resume on Thursday, November 6, following the regular Monday-to-Friday schedule. This holiday marks the 556th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev Ji, the founder of Sikhism.

title: How to pronounce Zohran Mamdani's name? What does it mean?
content: For months, anchors, opponents, and even allies stumbled over it. Zor-han Mandami. Zohr-anne Madani. One Republican rival reportedly gave up halfway through a live debate and settled on “the assemblyman.”

title: Chhattisgarh: Train hit parked cargo rake after signal breach; toll rises to 11
content: A local train collided with a stationary cargo rake in Chhattisgarh, resulting in 11 passenger deaths and at least 20 injuries. Preliminary reports suggest a signal breach caused the devastating crash. Rescue and relief efforts are underway, with authorities investigating the incident and providing compensation to victims.

title: Kirk Herbstreit trends after Tom Brady reveals he cloned his beloved dog
content: NFL legend Tom Brady has reportedly cloned his late dog Lua, naming the new pet Junie. Using blood collected before Lua's passing, biotech firm Colossal Biosciences, in which Brady is an investor, facilitated the cloning. This revelation has sparked widespread debate among fans and celebrities, touching on themes of love, loss, and the ethical implications of advanced technology.

title: Zohran Mamdani becomes New York Mayor: What is his religion?
content: Zohran Mamdani, a Shia Muslim raised in an interfaith family, has captured New York City's heart, symbolising a break from the old guard. Despite facing Islamophobic attacks and criticism over his anti-Zionist stance, his honesty and empathy resonated with voters, making him a historic mayor. His faith, personal and political, are rooted in the people who elected him.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment with daughter Gianna Bryant
content: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams “disgusting” Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: Women’s World Cup - 'Not on the same level with 1983': Gavaskar’s bold take on India win
content: Indian women's cricket achieved a historic World Cup victory, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. This triumph, a culmination of persistence after previous near misses, drew parallels to the 1983 men's win. Legendary Sunil Gavaskar highlighted the win's significance, emphasizing sporting intelligence and the role of Indian coaches, while noting the women's team's established track record before this breakthrough.

title: Rahul Gandhi's vote manipulation claim in Haryana unfounded: EC source
content: Rahul Gandhi’s claims of vote rigging in Haryana elections were dismissed by the Election Commission, noting no appeals were filed, raising questions about the validity of his allegations

title: Air India ferries 228 passengers stranded in Mongolia’s Ulaanbaatar to Delhi
content: The passengers were stranded in the Mongolian capital after their San Francisco-Delhi flight was diverted to Ulaanbaatar

title: Punjab Congress chief Warring booked over 'casteist' remarks on Buta Singh
content: Mr. Warring, the Punjab Congress chief tendered an "unconditional apology" and said that Buta Singh, a veteran leader of his party, was like a father figure to him

title: Rahul Gandhi alleges major ‘vote theft’ in 2024 Haryana polls; claims ECI in cahoots with BJP
content: The Congress leader claims that “thousands of people” were registered as voters in both Uttar Pradesh and Haryana

title: NYC mayoral election an “internal matter” of United States: official sources on Zohran Mamdani’s victory
content: The Hindu was told that Mamdani’s mention of the Indian leadership and developments in India on the campaign trail were viewed as a “desperate attempt” to polarise the Indian diaspora voters

title: Seven arrested for attacking PMK MLA Arul’s supporters in Salem
content: A violent clash had broken out around 11 a.m. on Tuesday when Mr. Arul was returning from the house of the PMK Pethanaickenpalayam union secretary

title: EESL to set up India’s largest geothermal energy technology pilot project in Andhra Pradesh
content: “EESL will set up two installations in Araku Valley and Visakhapatnam as a part of it,” according to an official release

title: Tech has transformed public buses, but some routes still see run-down service: SC
content: The Court noted that STCs were inconsistent with their service improvements, observing that “in certain areas/routes old buses which are on the verge of being phased out are being plied”

title: 12 States to spend ₹1.68 lakh crore on women's cash schemes: report
content: Twelve Indian States plan to allocate ₹1.68 lakh crore for women’s cash transfer schemes by 2025-26, reflecting a significant increase amid fiscal pressures and growing welfare expenditures

title: Watch: Mamata Banerjee warns BJP will fall if a voter is removed under SIR 2.0
content: Leading a protest march in Kolkata, she accused the BJP and the Election Commission of using the revision drive as a political tool to intimidate voters and manipulate the rolls.

title: Boats and coracles to be procured for flood rescue in Tamil Nadu
content: Nearly 200 coracles, each costing ₹13,000, are to be acquired for areas where waterlogging is not expected to be too deep

title: Watch: Death toll rises to 11 in Chhattisgarh train crash near Bilaspur
content: The MEMU passenger train had crashed into a stationary goods train on November 4, leaving 20 others injured. A detailed investigation is underway as authorities announce compensation for the victims and their families.

title: Suresh Gopi tells Kerala govt not to exaggerate extreme poverty eradication claims as ‘ploy to mislead people for another five years’
content: However, Union Minister says he will have no objection if State government’s claims are indeed factual

title: Matheran's popular toy train to roll again from November 6
content: As a precautionary measure for the monsoon season, the train services between Neral and Matheran were suspended from June to October

title: Monorail train tilts in Mumbai during test run; no passengers inside
content: A monorail train tilting during a test run in Mumbai’s Wadala depot on November 5 morning raises concerns amid ongoing technical issues in the suspended service

title: Rahul Gandhi ‘revelation’ on voter theft LIVE: Voter fraud being centrally carried out, Rahul Gandhi claims massive rigging in Haryana Assembly elections
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi claims that there was no election in Haryana, there was a 'theft' in the State, and it is very clear who did it.

title: NCB arrests absconding suspect in 2010 drug trafficking case
content: The agency had seized 976 g of heroin at a private bus terminus in Koyambedu, Chennai, in November 2010. Three suspects were arrested, while Ravi remained absconding in the case

title: Five killed while crossing track at Chunar railway station in Uttar Pradesh’s Mirzapur
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the incident and directed district officials to expedite relief measures

title: Special Intensive Revision: District Collectors in Kerala directed to avoid overlap of SIR and local body election works
content: Personnel engaged in conduct of local body elections will not be entrusted with BLO duties during SIR. In instances where staff involved in local body election work are also designated as BLO, they will be replaced by other officials, says Chief Electoral Officer (Kerala) Rathan Kelkar

title: FTA talks: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal visits New Zealand to review progress
content: “The two countries will look forward to expediting the process for a comprehensive, mutually beneficial economic partnership,” Union Minister Piyush Goyal said

title: Encounter breaks out between security forces, terrorists in J&K’s Kishtwar
content: According to officials, the encounter began after the Jammu and Kashmir Police, assisted by the Indian Army and the CRPF, launched a joint operation in the Chhatru area

title: MARBH grants conditional permission to restore seats in BHMS, MD in Rajamahendravaram’s Homeopathic Medical College
content: The college is being allowed to take admission into 23 MD seats and an additional 13 seats in BHMS from the academic year 2025-26

title: Blue Futures exhibition at Hampi Art Labs reimagines legacy of indigo
content: Archival material, sound, and contemporary visuals together map indigo’s evolution across India, West Africa and Japan to modern design studios around the world

title: Nara Bhuvaneswari honoured with two prestigious awards in London
content: Nara Bhuvaneswari was conferred with the ‘Distinguished Fellowship 2025 Award’ for her exceptional contributions to public service and social impact through the NTR Memorial Trust

title: Chhattisgarh train accident: Death roll rises to 11
content: The impact of the collision was so severe that a coach of the passenger train ended up on top of a wagon of the cargo train

title: Why Chennai’s Victoria Public Hall deserves to be restored
content: Despite questions about the money being spent on its restoration, the city’s hall deserves this work. Some symbols must be preserved, and this is one of them.

title: U.P. Factories (Amendment) Act enforced; allows govt to extend max daily working hours to 12
content: Under the new provisions, the State government is empowered to extend the maximum daily working hours in factories to 12 hours, provided that the total weekly working hours do not exceed 48

title: Tamil Nadu’s ‘encounters’ with artificial rain-making over the last 50 years
content: In 1993, when Chennai was gripped by yet another spell of water shortage, the trials were done. But, by then, a consensus had emerged among the scientific community that no area got any more than 20% of rainfall over and above normal

title: Post Op Sindoor, more lessons learned, need to be incorporated into model: CDS on theaterisation
content: Gen Anil Chauhan also spoke of the role of the CDS, and recalled that the top post does not have an operational mandate

title: House panel directs APMSIDC to submit audit reports
content: PSUs must function with transparency and accountability, ensuring timely completion of audits every financial year, says Chairman of Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly’s Public Undertakings Committee Koona Ravi Kumar

title: When Jayalalithaa proposed chemical castration for rapists
content: The alleged gang rape of a 20-year-old college student two days ago in Coimbatore has once again prompted discussions on severe punishment for sexual assault. Way back in 2013, then Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J. Jayalalithaa advocated chemical castration for rapists and the then DMK president Karunanidhi batted for solitary life imprisonment.

title: UPSC maintains status quo on appointing T.N. DGP
content: According to official sources, the UPSC has written back to the Tamil Nadu government reiterating its decision on the panel of DGP candidates fit for appointment as DGP/HoPF.

title: Five persons held in Vellore for stealing two-wheelers
content: Three persons were lodged at Central Prison in Vellore. Two juveniles were sent to the government home.

title: Be a brand ambassador for Dravidian model of governance: Udhayanidhi Stalin
content: Mr. Udhayanidhi inaugurated 31 completed works including a new sub-registrar building in Gudiyatham, additional classrooms, and anganwadi centres to a tune of ₹ 11.80 crore

title: Punch-marked gold coins dating back to Vijayanagara-era unearthed in Tiruvannamalai
content: Officials of HR&CE, which was involved in restoration of the ancient temple at a cost of ₹ 2.5 crore, said that a group of workers were digging a trench in the sanctum sanctorum when they hit a small pot.

title: Part of 75-year-old overbridge collapses in M.P.’s Indore; municipal corporation blames rats
content: Officials said the repair work is being carried out according to standards of the Indian Roads Congress (IRC) and based on recommendations of civil engineering experts

title: HC directs Collector’s panel to oversee canal and drainage systems in Kochi
content: The committee should ensure completion of construction of Mullassery Canal under Operation Breakthrough Phase – III and that of culverts by Railways, says court

title: Kochi Mayor adjourns council meeting after declaring passage of agenda
content: The meeting, potentially the final one of the current term of the Corporation, lasted just 30 minutes; Opposition UDF protests against the ‘abrupt dismissal’ of the meeting without discussion

title: Kochi to be turned into a beautified, litter-free city
content: The urban beautification project aims to establish a permanent mechanism for maintaining clean pavements and adjoining areas, besides sprucing up medians and compound walls of nearby establishments by planting flowering plants

title: 17-year-old girl shot at by stalker in Haryana’s Faridabad, hunt on for accused
content: The main accused — seen waiting for her in the street in CCTV footage, walking up to her and then shooting her at point-blank range — has been identified as 20-year-old Jatin Mangla, who worked as an accountant, from Sarmathla village near Sohna in Gurugram

title: Maharashtra cabinet approves 21 key decisions in one go ahead of local body elections
content: The cabinet chaired by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis also made some significant changes in policies for farmers, labourers, healthcare workers, and the judicial workforce, holding administrative and socio-economic significance

title: Case booked against government school teacher who beat up student in Puzhuthivakkam
content: The Tamil Nadu State Commission for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes calls for a report from the police over a complaint that relevant Sections of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989 had not been invoked in the complaint

title: Bombay HC grants bail to 2011 Mumbai triple blast accused after 13 years
content: The Bombay High Court cited constitutional right to speedy trial and said that prolonged incarceration cannot justify indefinite detention.

title: Madras High Court pulls up Chennai cybercrime police for freezing bank account of publicly listed company
content: Justice M. Nirmal Kumar says, non adherence to a 2021 circular issued by Greater Chennai Commissioner of Police cannot be taken lightly

title: Bihar’s electoral battles should be about land, not caste alone
content: Decades of “social justice” politics have brought backward castes to power. But the wealth remains with a tiny forward caste elite. Why won’t anyone talk about redistribution?

title: NGO begins campaign in Karnataka to display Constitution’s Preamble in private institutions
content: To spread awareness about the Constitution, the Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Organisation, a non-government organisation, has launched a Statewide campaign to display the Preamble of the Constitution in the offices of cooperative societies, milk federations, private banks, and educational institutions across the State

title: Action sought after photo of inspector celebrating birthday with history-sheeters in Yadgir goes viral
content: A photograph of an inspector in Yadgir district allegedly celebrating his birthday with history-sheeters has gone viral on social media drawing strong reaction from members of Dalit organisations who have sought action against him

title: Ensuring clean environment to the next generation is everyone’s responsibility, says KSPCB chairman
content: MLA and chairman of Karnataka State Pollution Control Board P.M. Narendraswamy has said that passing on clean environment the next generation was responsibility of everyone and there should be collective contribution towards reducing pollution and people should use eco friendly vehicles

title: Adoptions of girls outnumber those of boys in Kalaburagi district
content: In a remarkable shift in adoption trends, female children are adopted at a higher rate than male children in Kalaburagi district over the past six years, according to the Department of Women and Child Welfare

title: Ahmedabad’s Atal Bridge attracts 77.7 lakh visitors, generates ₹27 crore revenue
content: Between April and October 2025, the bridge received 8.51 lakh visitors and collected ₹4.82 crore in revenue

title: Suvendu Adhikari leads ‘Parivartan Yatra’ rally, demands ‘proper’ execution of SIR in West Bengal
content: This comes on the on the same day that Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee held a rally in Kolkata against the SIR process

title: Kerala University PhD scholar alleges caste bias, abuse of power by Sanskrit department head
content: He accuses the HoD of attempting to sabotage his PhD evaluation by falsely claiming that he does not know Sanskrit

title: TH Impact: Domestic help assault: 3 staff suspended, PSI faces action
content: Three personnel suspended, and Rule 7 proceedings initiated against sub-inspector for lack of supervision

title: Tejashwi vows to transfer ₹30,000 on Makar Sankranti if INDIA bloc comes to power
content: Tejashwi Yadav also announces that farmers would be given ₹300 per quintal of paddy and ₹400 for wheat as a bonus over Minimum Support Price (MSP), if the INDIA bloc comes to power in Bihar

title: Minister promotes Andhra Pradesh tourism at World Travel Market 2025 in London
content: Durgesh showcases State’s natural beauty, heritage sites, and investment potential; highlights cultural performances and sustainable tourism initiatives

title: GSAT-7R will strengthen Indian Navy’s surveillance and communication in the Indian Ocean Region
content: The GSAT-7R is the successor to the GSAT-7 “Rukmini,” India’s first dedicated military satellite, launched in 2013. While Rukmini revolutionised naval communications by providing real-time data links across the Arabian Sea and the Bay of Bengal, the GSAT-7R significantly upgrades these capabilities.

title: EBC voters hold the key to Bihar polls, Nitish remains their preferred choice
content: The Mahagatbandhan’s success in the Bihar elections hinges on its ability to break into Nitish Kumar’s loyal vote bank; in the 2020 polls, the victory margin was below 5,000 in 52 seats, and a minor shift in the caste-based political loyalties could change the outcome this time

title: After visit to Vantara, global wildlife committee recommends India pause animal import
content: The reservations of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES) committee rose from observations where permit codes did not appropriately reflect the arrangement between the exporting country and India

title: 7 years on, 2 convicted for killing private firm employee in road rage incident
content: Coincidentally, the verdict and sentencing came on the birthday of the victim, Siddarth Koushal, a native of Bihar who was working for a private firm in the city

title: SP renews push for full-fledged AMU centre in Kishanganj as Akhilesh’s Bihar campaign gathers pace
content: Party links demand to Seemanchal’s educational backwardness; calls for strengthening secular and socialist forces

title: SIR second phase begins in nine States, three U.T.s
content: The exercise will cover 51 crore voters; West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee alleges ‘silent, invisible rigging’, while ruling DMK in Tamil Nadu moves Supreme Court, terming the exercise ‘arbitrary’

title: South Western Railway launches ‘MUTS Sahayak’ ticketing scheme at KSR Bengaluru
content: The move is aimed at easing congestion at ticket counters and providing commuters with a quicker, hassle-free option for purchasing tickets, according to officials

title: Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Alabama top CFP ranking
content: In the release of the first rankings of the College Football Playoff on Tuesday night, coach Ryan Day and his unbeaten Ohio State Buckeyes topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: Jets GM thrilled for 'value' in 2 blockbuster deals
content: Jets GM Darren Mougey said the trades of defensive cornerstones Sauce Gardner and Quinnen Williams did not represent "a teardown," stating instead, "The goal is always to win."

title: Source: RHP Bieber staying with Blue Jays in '26
content: Pitcher Shane Bieber opted into his $16 million player option with the Blue Jays for the 2026 season, choosing to forgo free agency, according to multiple reports.

title: Magic's Bane tossed after firing ball at Okongwu
content: Desmond Bane was ejected Tuesday after committing a hard foul on Onyeka Okongwu and firing the ball at the Hawks' center while he fell to the floor.

title: Red-hot Bulls rally from 24 down to topple 76ers
content: The Bulls stormed back from a 24-point deficit to beat the 76ers on a late go-ahead 3-pointer in a battle between the early leaders in the East.

title: Preds irked as Wild net winner with net displaced
content: The Minnesota Wild scored a controversial overtime goal with the net displaced Tuesday night, and the Nashville Predators, who fell 3-2, addressed it after the loss, with coach Andrew Brunette saying the team disagrees with the opinion of the officials.

title: Strong, Fudd lead new-look UConn over Louisville
content: Led by stars Sarah Strong and Azzi Fudd, defending champion and preseason No. 1 UConn picked up where it left off Tuesday against No. 20 Louisville, earning a 79-66 victory in the first women's Armed Forces Classic matchup.

title: Boozer takes over game after Scheyer's challenge
content: After failing to score in the first half, Duke freshman Cameron Boozer rallied to finish with 15 points and 13 rebounds -- 10 of those after halftime -- as the Blue Devils overcame a 33-32 halftime deficit to beat Texas in the Dick Vitale Invitational.

title: 💪 Latest NFL Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 10. Plus, we picked out a critical game remaining on the schedule for every team.

title: Winners, losers of a wild NFL trade deadline: Solak weighs in on the Jets, Cowboys and Jakobi Meyers

title: Sauce Gardner traded?!? Barnwell on the Colts' risky all-in move and what comes next
content: The Colts shocked the NFL by dealing two first-round picks and Adonai Mitchell to the Jets for Sauce Gardner. But is this the right time to get aggressive?

title: Jets trade Sauce Gardner to Colts: Last piece to Super Bowl puzzle? What's N.Y. thinking?
content: The 7-2 Colts are going all-in on a Super Bowl run, while trading the CB was just part of the Jets' busy day.

title: Why the Cavaliers are doubling down despite two straight playoff disappointments
content: After two disappointing playoff exits, the Cavaliers aren't making any major changes to their schemes or plans. In fact, they're doubling down.

content: ESPN national analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton debate the biggest early-season questions about Victor Wembanyama, Austin Reaves, Cooper Flagg and more.

content: The Golden State superstar identified Trae Young as the player who made him realize his impact on the league.

content: From playoff breakouts to World Series heroes, here's a full squad of players who shined brightest under the postseason lights.

content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four has shown her peak powers only in small glimpses. Now Azzi Fudd is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

content: Koa Peat's 30 points in the Wildcats' win over the reigning champs highlights big night of freshmen debuts.

title: Predicting the rest of the Premier League season: How all 20 teams will finish
content: After 10 games, we now have enough data to predict every Premier League team's final spot in the standings for the 2025-26 season.

title: How much do Barça depend on Pedri? With midfielder injured, we're about to find out
content: Pedri's injury comes at a critical time for Barcelona and Spain, both of whom rely on his unique skills.

content: Heading toward Survivor Series: WarGames next month, CM Punk and The Usos isn't the only alliance taking form.

title: Pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United prepare January bid for Elliot Anderson
content: Manchester United want Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson to bolster their midfield. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Mira Nair Picks A Cannes Moment From 1988 To Describe Son Zohran Mamdani
content: Mira Nair's son Zohran Mamdani has won the mayoral elections in New York and is now set to become the city's first Muslim mayor.

title: How Rama Duwaji, Zohran Mamdani's Wife, Devised A Winning Campaign
content: While Zohran Mamdani captured national attention with his historic New York City mayoral win, his wife Rama Duwaji quietly played a major role behind the scenes.

title: TVK Empowers Vijay For Alliance Move At 1st High-Level Meet Since Stampede
content: At its first General Council meeting since the Karur stampede that killed 41 people, the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) met in Mamallapuram and passed 12 resolutions.

title: US Proposes Draft UN Resolution To Lift Sanctions On Syrian President
content: The United States has proposed a draft United Nations Security Council resolution that would lift sanctions on Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa, who is due to meet US President Donald Trump at the White House on Monday.

title: Rama Duwaji, New York's Gen Z First Lady And Face Behind Mamdani's Victory
content: Rama Dwaji, the 28-year-old wife of New York's mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, who mostly opts to stay out of the spotlight, was on stage with him when he declared his victory over former governor Andrew Cuomo.

title: 2 Suicide Attempts At Andhra College In 4 Days. One Dead, Another Critical
content: A second-year engineering student jumped to death from the third floor of the college building in Andhra Pradesh on Monday. The incident comes four days after another engineering student attempted to end her life.

title: US Elections LIVE Updates: Zohran Mamdani Calls New York 'Light In Political Darkness' In First Speech
content: US Mayoral Election 2025 LIVE: In the United States, New York City, New Jersey, Virginia, and California are voting in the first major Election Day since President Donald Trump returned to the White House.

title: "ED A Model Agency": Watchdog FATF Praises India's Asset Recovery System
content: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF), the global body that monitors efforts against money laundering and terror financing, has praised India's asset recovery framework.

title: Rs 70 Crore Fraud At EPFO Credit Society, 2 Arrested From Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru Police have arrested two individuals in connection with a Rs 70 crore fraud involving the Employees Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) Staff Credit Co-operative Society.

title: All About Mira Nair And Mahmood Mamdani, Zohran Mamdani's Parents
content: Zohran Kwame Mamdani today waselected mayor of New York City, after he defeated former governor Andrew Cuomo, who ran as an independent, and Republican Curtis Sliwa.

title: Soldiers, Jeeps, Armour To Combat Bears In Japan Town Known For Hot Springs
content: Japan's military deployed troops to the country's mountainous north on Wednesday to help trap bears after an urgent request from local authorities struggling to cope with a wave of attacks.

title: Salman Khan Lands In Legal Trouble Over 'Misleading' Pan Masala Ad Claims
content: Bollywood actor Salman Khan has landed in legal trouble after a complaint was filed against him in the Kota Consumer Court, alleging that advertisements for a popular pan masala brand endorsed by him were "misleading."

title: Madhya Pradesh Court Fines Collector Rs 2 Lakh For Wrongful Detention Under Anti-Terror Law
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has come down heavily on the Shahdol administration for gross negligence in invoking the National Security Act (NSA) against an innocent man, ordering contempt proceedings against the district collector

title: Mira Nair's First Reaction To Son Zohran Mamdani's Win Is An Insta Reshare
content: Indian-American filmmaker Mira Nair on Tuesday shared Indian movie director Zoya Akhtar's praise for the former's son Zohran Mamdani on his electoral victory in the crucial New York Mayor elections.

title: Tata Electronics Woman Employee Arrested For Placing Camera In Hostel Toilet
content: A female employee of Tata Electronics has been arrested for allegedly placing a hidden camera inside the toilet of the women's hostel provided by the company in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district.

title: "And So It Begins...": Trump Takes Note Of Mamdani's All-Out Attack
content: Trump was indeed watching, and has taken note. "...AND SO IT BEGINS!" he wrote on his platform Truth Social just as Mamdani wrapped up his 30-minute speech.

title: Perplexity Gets Legal Threat From Amazon Over AI Agent Helping Users Shop
content: Perplexity AI said on Tuesday it has received a legal threat from Amazon.com demanding that the startup block the AI agent on its Comet browser from shopping on the ecommerce giant's platform on a user's behalf.

title: BJP Shares 'Musical Chair' AI Video Amid Karnataka Chief Minister Tussle
content: Taking a swipe at the tussle within Karnataka Congress over the Chief Minister's post, the BJP has posted an AI-generated video showing four top Congress leaders in a game of musical chair for the top job

title: 2nd Kabaddi Player Killed In A Week In Punjab, Bishnoi Gang Claims Responsibility
content: A kabaddi player has been killed less than a week after a similar murder that shook the Ludhiana district in Punjab last week. Gurwinder Singh was killed in the Samrala block, with the notorious Lawrence Bishnoi gang claiming responsibility.

title: Encounter Underway Between Terrorists, Security Forces In J&K's Kishtwar
content: A fierce gunbattle is underway between terrorists and security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district.
